tool.name: DirectionalBuffer

param.name: polygonType
param.dialogReference: Describes the polygon as “Rectangles” or “Irregular”

param.name: xyzUnit
param.dialogReference: Identifies the horizontal units of the dimensions for the layout design inputs (Foot or Meter)

param.name: xEast
param.displayname: Distance to buffer to the east
param.dialogReference: Distance in the measurement units to buffer the polygon eastward

param.name: xWest
param.displayname: Distance to buffer to the west
param.dialogReference: Distance in the measurement units to buffer the polygon westward

param.name: yNorth
param.displayname: Distance to buffer to the north
param.dialogReference: Distance in the measurement units to buffer the polygon northward

param.name: ySouth
param.displayname: Distance to buffer to the south
param.dialogReference: Distance in the measurement units to buffer the polygon southward

param.name: fnVar
param.dialogReference: A value > 0 and <= 2. Only applicable to the “Irregular” option. Lower values will be more accurate, but will consume more memory

param.name: polygonOutput
param.dialogReference: The output feature class of the directionally-buffered polygon

tool.summary:
Creates buffers dynamically in the cardinal directions from input polygons. Buffers can be variable in each direction.

  • This tool was designed for rectangular polygons (for example, tracker rows), but can handle irregularly-shaped polygons.

  • An input is an option to describe the input polygons as “Rectangles” or “Irregular”.

    • Do not use the “Irregular” option for rectangular polygons – the buffers may not be exactly correct.

    • The buffers for irregular polygons are based on an algorithm that estimates the offset from the boundaries based on each individual side and the relationship to the offsets. The offset may not be exact. The smaller the number in the “Accuracy resolution” variable for irregular, the more exact the offset will be. However, the smaller the number the longer the tool will take to run.

    • It is not recommended to use the “Irregular” option on very large polygons, as it can cause ArcGIS and your computer to crash due to memory limitations.

  • This tool does not support negative buffers.
